questions.question: What events occurred in Watts and Detroit in the 1960's?
How did the Supreme Court rule in Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka, Kansas?

choices.answer: All nine justices ruled for segregation
All nine justices ruled against segregation

questions.question: Who were the Little Rock Nine?

choices.answer: White teachers who tried to teach African Americans
White students that attended African American schools

questions.question: The Civil Rights Act of 1964 did which of the following?

choices.answer: Provided federal supervision over voter registration
Established a federal policy of affirmative action
Started a jobs program in inner cities

questions.question: The strategy of nonviolent resistance was based on the tactics used by which leader?
What peaceful protest tactic was used in 50 southern cities in 1960?
The Freedom Rides ended after which of the following events?

choices.answer: The federal Interstate Commerce Commission issued new rules
The Supreme Court declared segregation unconstitutional
Martin Luther King Jr. declared a protest march
A violent mob attacked and killed many Freedom Riders

questions.question: Why was the Montgomery bus boycott significant?

choices.answer: Its failure led to the creation of SCLC
Its success inspired African American communities
Its failure encouraged Martin Luther King Jr.

questions.question: What was the largest civil rights demonstration ever held in the United States?
What issue did the 24th Amendment address?
What was the purpose of the Kerner Commission?

choices.answer: to investigate the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.
to study the causes of urban rioting
to determine the psychological effects of segregation
to evaluate the effectiveness of civil rights  legislation

questions.question: How did Stokely Carmichael explain Black Power?

choices.answer: as a call to violet action
as a call to racial harmony

questions.question: Which Black Muslim minister offered a message of defiance, and black pride?
What role did TV networks play in civil rights protests?

choices.answer: They demonized the protesters and their causes
They refused to broadcast images of the protest
They broadcast images of violence toward African Americans
They demonstrated a strong bias in favor of the protesters

questions.question: Which party in Congress had a higher percentage of members who voted for the Civil Rights Act of 1964?

choices.answer: About the same percentage of Democrats and Republicans
Congress did not record the vote
